intro: Thlaspi telephiifolium, commonly known as the alpine cabbages, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many familiar plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant is characterized by its rosette of basal leaves that are typically covered in a dense layer of white, waxy hairs. It produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a raceme, which bloom in the summer months. Thlaspi telephiifolium is adapted to cold, alpine environments and is often found growing in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations.
